main event: Mr. Russell O. Womack, Jr. observed an unusual aerial phenomenon at Holloman AFB, Alamogordo, New Mexico on 6 January 1950 at 2230 hours.
interesting points: The object changed colors from bright white to blue to red., The sighting lasted for approximately 45 minutes., The object was slightly larger than Venus and was seen at an altitude of about 15Â° above the horizon., The object's flight path was erratic as it traversed from east to west., Multiple reliable airmen witnessed the event alongside the lead observer.
sighted object: One bright white to red changing light
witness description: Sgt. John D. Ritchie, Cpl. Galen K. Greseth, Cpl. Vincent M. Hamilton, Pfc. John M. Guischy, Pvt. Thomas H. Leroy, Sgt. Harold J. Rollins - all reliable airmen
